hotspots.hotspot:
Stage 1

This is the transition stage between being awake and being asleep. You drift into and out of sleep and can be easily awakened.

Stage 2

This is a stage of light sleep where the brain produces bursts of rapid wave activity called sleep spindles.

Stage 3

Deep, slow brain waves called delta waves begin to emerge along with shorter waves. This is the transition stage between light and deep sleep.

Stage 4

Deep sleep occurs in this stage due to exclusive production of delta waves.

Stage 5 or REM sleep

Rapid Eye Movement (REM) in this stage indicates increased brain activity. You dream during this stage.

multiple.question: What do you think were the results of the study?

answers.answer: Group A players didn't find the hidden answer but solved the game faster than those who slept.
Group B players were three times more likely to have insight that allowed them to find the hidden rule than those who did not sleep.

figure.text:
A research study gave participants a game to play that required math calculations. Unknown to the participants, there was a hidden rule that, if discovered, would allow them to identify final answers quicker.

  • Group A: Played the game, did other things for 8 hours, and then played the game again.
  • Group B: Played the game in early evening, slept for 8 hours, and then played again after awakening.
